member.name: M:PixelLab.SL.GridLineControl.RequestGridUpdate
member.summary: Called internally to let us know that something has changed that requires a recalculation of the grid. This method will cue up a change for the next render.

member.name: M:PixelLab.SL.PanZoomControl.OnApplyTemplate
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, is invoked whenever application code or internal processes (such as a rebuilding layout pass) call . In simplest terms, this means the method is called just before a UI element displays in an application. For more information, see Remarks.

member.summary: Computes the relative offset for a given offset
member.param: actual non-scaled offset to be converted
actual width/height of the viewable area

member.summary: Computes the actual (non-scaled) offset for a given relative offset
member.param: actual width/height of the viewable area

member.summary: The color used to draw the major grid lines

member.summary: The color used to draw the minor / subdividing grid lines

member.name: P:PixelLab.SL.PanZoomControl.MajorGridLineDistance
member.summary: The distance between each of the major division gridlines

member.summary: The number of subdivisions between the major grid lines

member.name: P:PixelLab.SL.PanZoomControl.Scale
member.summary: Indicates how the current scale (level of zoom)

member.name: P:PixelLab.SL.PanZoomControl.OffsetX
member.summary: The X offset (before scale is applied). OffsetX and OffsetY are always in the "non-scaled" coordinate space. This means that if you are scaled at 2x and update OffsetX by 1 pixel, the scaled content will appear to move 2 pixels.

member.name: P:PixelLab.SL.PanZoomControl.ClipToBounds
member.summary: A description of the property.

member.name: P:PixelLab.SL.PanZoomControl.CanPan
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance can pan.
member.value: True if this instance can pan; otherwise, false.
